qas.question: How many floors does the Planalto have?
How many floors are in the Palacio da Alvoarada?
What is the area of the Palacio de Alvorada?

plausible_answers.text: the Vice-President of Brazil and the Chief of Staff

qas.question: Who also has offices in the Alvorada?
What is the official workplace of Oscar Niemeyer?
What is used as a metonym for the chief of staff of government?

context: <b8_0>The <a2_0><a4_0>Palácio do Planalto<b8_0/><a4_0/><a2_0/> is the official workplace of the President of Brazil. It is located at the Praça dos Três Poderes in Brasília. As the seat of government, the term <b9_0>"Planalto"<b9_0/> is often used as a metonym for the executive branch of government. The main working office of the President of the Republic is in the Palácio do Planalto. The President and his or her family do not live in it, rather in the official residence, the Palácio da Alvorada. Besides the President, senior advisors also have offices in the "Planalto," including <b7_0>the Vice-President of Brazil and the Chief of Staff<b7_0/>. The other Ministries are along the Esplanada dos Ministérios. The architect of the Palácio do Planalto was <a3_0>Oscar Niemeyer<a3_0/>, creator of most of the important buildings in Brasília. The idea was to project an image of simplicity and modernity using fine lines and waves to compose the columns and exterior structures. The Palace is <a0_0><b5_0>four<b5_0/><a0_0/> stories high, and has an area of <a1_0><b6_0>36,000 m2<b6_0/><a1_0/>. Four other adjacent buildings are also part of the complex.
